attributes.action: Public Inquiry into Covid-19 arrangements for Approved Driving Instructors/PDIs
attributes.additional_details:
ADIs have to temporarily resign or face removal from the ADI register if they fail to take their four-yearly test, and no exceptions have been made during the current outbreak. 
 
A public inquiry should: 
  
Have unlimited power to obtain all records from DVSA 
Establish the No. of Approved Driving Instructors (ADIs) & Potential Driving Instructors (PDIs) forced to resign or are removed from ADI Register by the DVSA 
Establish whether any ADIs died after being required to work or take ADI/PDI tests during COVID-19 
Establish the role of the DVSA Chief Executive & Secretary of State for Transport in decision about arrangements for ADIs
attributes.background: There should be a Public inquiry into arrangements for Approved Driving Instructors during the Covid-19 outbreak, including why the option to defer tests has not been made available, despite 3 lockdowns and local restrictions.
